patterns: What is Mental Health?
What is mental health problem?
When does mental health occur?
What do you mean by mental health
responses: We all have mental health which is made up of our beliefs, thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. Which includes our emotional, psychological, and social well-being. It affects how we think, feel, and act. It also helps determine how we handle stress, relate to others, and make healthy choices.

patterns: Can we prevent mental health?
Does all people suffer from mental health problems?
responses: All people can suffer mental health challenges, but developing our well-being, and resilience, and seeking help early can prevent challenges from becoming serious.

patterns: What causes Mental health problem?
What causes mental health issues?
Causes of mental health problem
What caueses of mental illness
responses: Challenges or problems with mental health can arise from pyschological, biological, and social issues as well as life, events.

patterns: Are there cures for mental health problems?
Is there any cure for mental health illness?
Are there any treatments for mental health issues?
Is it possible to find a cure for mental health issues?
What can you suggest to cure my mental problems?
responses: It is often more realistic and helpful to find out what helps with the issues you face. Talking, counseling, medication, friendships, exercise, good sleep and nutrition, and meaningful occupation can all help.

patterns: How does mental health affect physical health?
What effect does mental health have on physical health?
What impact does mental health have on physcal health?
How can mental health effect physical health?
Is it possible to affect my physical health because of my mental health?
responses: Mental health and physical health go hand-in-hand. For example, physical exercise can improve your mood and reduce your anxiety, among many others benefits. Similarly, neglecting your mental health can lead to serious health complications, including heart disease, high blood pressure, a weakened immune system, obesity, and more.

patterns: What are the causes of mental illness or mental health issues?
What causes mental illness or mental health issues?
What factors lead to mental illnes or mental health problems?
responses: Mental health issues are usually caused by various physical, environmental, and social factors. Physical factors can include a person’s genetic makeup, abuse of substances like street drugs or alcohol, or physical trauma. Social factors include our support networks, like friends or family members, where we live, and work conditions. Environmental factors can include severe psychological trauma caused by events like sexual abuse or war.

patterns: How can I tell if someone has a mental health problem?
How can I determine if someone has a mental illness?
sign of having mental problems
How can I determine if someone is experienceing mental health issues
responses: If someone is experiencing or showing a sign of having mental healt problems, they may show significant mood swings, or appear more withdrawn if they are dealing with self-harm or negative thoughts, but everything is dependent on the individual and there is no one way to know whether someone is unwell.

patterns: Who should I talk to about mental health problmes?
What should I tell if Im having expereince of mental health illness
Who should I talk to?
Can you suggest who should I talk to
kakausapin ko ba si hotdog
responses: The first step you can take is simply to consult a general practitioner or family doctor. Talking with a doctor can help clarify your options and rule out physical causes for mental health problems. While it might feel difficult at first to talk to your doctor about your thoughts and feelings, this discussion may help you access the counseling services you need.

I'm unwell
Hindi ako okay
Ano ang gagawin ko kapag hindi ako okay
What to do?
responses: If your beliefs, thoughts, feelings or behaviours have a significant impact on your ability to function in what might be considered a normal or ordinary way, it would be important to seek help.

intents.tag: I am worried about Mental Health
patterns: What do I do if I'm worried about my mental health
Im worried about my mental health
what should I do to not be worried
Im worried about what Im feeling
responses: The most important thing is to talk to someone you trust. Specially your medical doctor of your psychiatrist or this might be a friend, colleague, family member or GP. In addtion talking to someone, it may be useful to find out more information about what you are experiencing. These things may help to get some perspective on what you are experiencing and be the start of getting help.

intents.tag: Difference of Mental illness and problems
patterns: What is the difference between mental illness and mental health?
What exactly is the difference of mental illness and mental problem?
What is mental illness?
mental illness
responses: Mental illness refers to a wide range of mental health conditions or disorders that affect a person's mood, thinking, and behaviour.

patterns: What causes mental illness?
causes of mental illness
ano ang dahilan ng mental illness
bakit ako meron nito?
responses: It is becoming clear through research that many of these conditions are caused by a combination of biological, psycholigical, and environmental factors.

patterns: How common are mental illness?
is mental illness are common?
ano ang dahilan ng mental illness
responses: Mental illnesses are very common. In fact, according to studies done by IDRAAC, 1 out 4 Lebanese adults is at risk of developing a mental disorder before the age of 75 years and this varies by country. Lebanon seems to be in the medium range.

patterns: What are some of the warning signs of mental illness?
symptoms of mental illness
what are the symptoms of mental illness
Do you have an idea what are the signs of having mental illness?
type and severity of the mental illness condition
responses: Symptoms of mental disorders vary depending on the type and severity of the condition. Some general symptoms that may suggest a mental illness includes:(1)Problems in concentration, (2) Long-lasting sadness or irritability, (3) Recurrent changes in energy, (4) Extremely high and low moods, (5) Excessive fear, worry, or anxiety, (6) Social withdrawal, (7) Dramatic changes in eating or sleeping habits, (8) Strong feelings of anger, (9) Delusions or hallucinations (seeing or hearing things that are not really there), (10) Increasing inability to cope with daily problems and activities, (11) Suicidal thoughts, (12) Many unexplained physical problems, (13) Confused thinking, (14) Abuse of drugs and/or alcohol.

patterns: What type of mental illness and mental health problems can be treated by a psychiatrist?
types of mentall illness and problems
what are the types that can be treated by a Medical Doctor?
responses: Psychiatrists can treat various mental health disorders, including (1) Addiction and substance use disorders, (2) Anxiety disorders , (3) Depression , (4) Dissociative disorders, (5) Eating disorders, (6) Gender dysphoria, (7) Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD), (8) Personality disorders, (9) Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), (10) Schizophrenia, and more.

patterns: What are some of the treatments of mental illness?
mental illness possible treatment
can you suggest what it the possible treatment in mental illness?
treatment methods
responses: Depending on the needs of the patient, psychiatrists can use different treatment methods, including Psychotherapy, Medication, psychosocial interventions, and more. So it is better to ask your specialist of your medical doctor.

patterns: What’s the difference between anxiety and stress?
How do stress and anxiety differ from one another?
how can you describe the difference of anxiety and stress
Is stress and anxiety are similar?
responses: While the physical sensations of anxiety and stress can be similar, their causes are usually different. Stress is usually caused by external pressures we’re having difficulty coping with. When we’re stressed, we usually know what we’re stressed about, and the symptoms of stress generally resolve themselves once the stressful situation ends.  Anxiety, on the other hand, is usually caused by worries or fears about potential threats or troubles, or even anxiety about the anxiety itself.

patterns: What’s the difference between sadness and depression?
sadness and drepression
How can you differentiate the sadness and depression
How can you tell if being sad and deppress are different
Ano ang pagkakaiba ng sadness at depression?
responses: Sadness is a normal reaction to some of life’s challenges. Feeling sad from time to time is a normal part of being human. If your feelings of sadness resolve themselves on their own over time and don’t impact your life in a big way, you’re probably not dealing with depression. That being said, if you continue to feel blue, it’s important to seek help, as depression doesn’t usually go away on its own. Depression is much more than low mood or sadness. Look for physical signs, such as problems with sleep, appetite, or energy.

patterns: What is Depression?
What are the symptoms of depression?
When does mental health depression happen?
responses: Depression is a mental health illness when someone feels sad (including crying often), empty, or hopeless most of the time (or loses interest in or takes no pleasure in daily activities) for at least 2 weeks. Depression affects a person’s ability to work, go to school, or have relationships with friends and family.

patterns: How long does mental health depression last?
How many months does depression knows?
How common is mental health depression?
responses: If left untreated, various types of depressive disorders can last for months or sometimes years. A major depressive episode is characterized by a set of symptoms that typically lasts for a few months.

patterns: How are abuse and trauma related to mental health?
Do you think that trauma can affect my mental health?
When does trauma happen?
responses: Trauma can happen after you experience an event or events that hurt you physically or emotionally. Trauma can have lasting effects on your mental, physical, and emotional health.

patterns: How do I know if my mental health is affected by past abuse or trauma?
What should I do if Ive been abused or traumatized?
responses: It can be difficult to tell whether or how much your mental health is affected by past abuse or trauma. The sooner you can get professional help for abuse or trauma, the sooner you can begin to get better.

patterns: How are abuse and trauma treated?
How are trauma and abuse handled?
There's a way to treated an abuse or trauma?
What are the ways to treated this traumas?
What should I do if I’ve been abused or traumatized?
responses: Symptoms caused by abuse or trauma can usually be treated with different types of talk therapy, medicine, or both. Therapy with a professional counselor can help you work through your feelings and learn healthy ways to cope. Medicines might include antidepressants or anti-anxiety medicine.

The sooner you can get professional help for abuse or trauma, the sooner you can begin to get better. If you have been physically hurt, visit a hospital or doctor right away. You may also need to call the police.

patterns: Does mental health treatment work?
That therapy better for mental health conditions?
What kind of treatment is better for mental health?
Treatment for mental health
Kind of therapies
responses: People can get better with treatment and other types of support. Different types of support and treatments might work for different people.Talking therapies such as cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) and counseling are becoming more widely available as part of the Improving Access to Psychological Therapies program.

patterns: What is Counseling?
Counseling works
Does counseling really help students with mental health conditions?
Does counseling really help people with mental health conditions?
responses: Counseling is designed to facilitate student achievement, improve student behavior and attendance, and help students develop socially. Mental health professionals with master’s degrees or beyond, and school counselors both provide counseling and serve an educational role in and around schools.

patterns: Is Confidentiality Guaranteed?
Confidentiality of people is okay?
If I talk to counselor, my identity and information still confidential?
Confidentiality of Information
responses: Everything you say is confidential and the therapists have taken out to protect your privacy during counseling sessions. You can ask the therapists questions before the session begins if you have concerns about the confidentiality of the process.

patterns: What is Stress?
Stress
When does it occur?
responses: Stress is how your body reacts to certain situations, such as sudden danger or long-lasting challenges. During stressful events, your body releases chemicals called hormones, such as adrenaline.

patterns: What causes stress?
Why stress happened?
Can you explain what the causes of stress?
What are the causes of stress?
responses: People can feel stress from many different things. Examples of common causes of long-term stress include Poverty and financial worries, Discrimination, and Traumatic Events.

patterns: What is mental breakdown?
What are the symptomps of having mental breakdown?
When do you say that Iam having breakdown?
responses: A mental breakdown (which is sometimes called a nervous breakdown) describes a period of severe mental illness or distress. People experiencing a mental breakdown may withdraw from life and avoid talking to friends and family.

patterns: Does social media affect mental health?
Why social media affect our mental health?
Using social media is helpful in our mental health?
Is social media good for our mental health?
responses: Social media keeps us connected with others but it doesnt always make us feel great. Research points to a link between high social media use and depression, anxiety, poor sleep, low self-esteem, and body image concerns.

patterns: Why do people attempt suicide?
How do you know if someone is attempting suicide?
What is the possible cause of suicide?
responses: Unfortunately, there is no simple answer to this question. People die by suicide for a number of reasons. A suicide attempt is a clear indication that something is gravely wrong in a persons life.

responses: There are several ways to talk to a family member, friend, co-worker, or acquaintance thinking about suicide.

responses: Self-care is an important part of managing stress. A few simple strategies you may want to try are yoga, lighting candles, taking baths, and reading a good book.

responses: When you feel nervous try relaxation techniques. Feeling nervous is natural — and part of your body's way of helping you do your best. The stress hormones (like adrenaline) that your body produces at times like these can actually help you focus.

responses: Hi, Friend! Don't worry if your are nervous the good news is that feeling nervous is completely normal. In fact, its an evolutionary reaction thats programmed into our brains! You need to take slow and deep breaths and count backwards slowly from 100. Challenge your thoughts and Change your focus. Okay?

patterns: Yes, i feel anxious

responses: When you feel anxious, take a few slow breaths. Breathe in slowly. Be sure to breathe out all the way. You can use your fingers to count four or five breaths, in and out. Instead, plan to tell yourself something that could help you face the moment with a bit of courage like, I can do this! or, It’s OK to feel anxious. I can do this anyway.

responses: Talk about your worries. It may seem like a simplistic solution, or finding hard to do it you may need a journal and write down your worries there. But talking face-to-face with a trusted friend or family member—someone who will listen to you without judging, criticizing, or continually being distracted—is one of the most effective ways to calm your nervous system and diffuse anxiety.

patterns: How is mental health treated?

treatments
responses: The common types of treatment for mental health illness are talk to Psychotherapy, medication, and Peer Support.

patterns: What is Psychotheraphy?
talk therapy/psychotherapy
psychotherapy
Mental health counselling
responses: Mental health illness is often treated with psychotherapy (also called talk therapy  or mental health counseling) Psychotherapy may help to talk through your concerns with a psychiatrist, psychologist or other mental health professional.

patterns: What happens in talk therapy?
How talk therapy happen?
Happenings in talk therapy
responses: In talk therapy (also called psychotherapy), you and a mental health professional talk about your feelings and discuss how to manage them. Sometimes, therapy is needed for only a few weeks, but it may be needed for a few months or longer.

patterns: What are the types of talk therapy?
Types of talk therapy
Talk Therapy types
responses: You may have one-on-one therapy with just you and the therapist or group therapy where you meet with a therapist and other people with problems similar to yours. Another option is family or couples therapy, in which you and your family members or your partner may work with a therapist.

patterns: What can happen if mental health is not treated?

Not treated mental health illness
What can happen if mental health illness is not treated?
What can happen if mental health problem is not treated?
responses: Without treatment, the consequences of mental illness for the individual and society are staggering. Untreated mental health conditions can result in unnecessary disability, unemployment, substance abuse, homelessness, inappropriate incarceration, and suicide, and poor quality of life.

patterns: If I think I have mental health, when should I see my health care provider?

responses: When restlessness is experienced more frequently and is accompanied by other symptoms, it can interrupt daily life and reduce a persons quality of life. Are you experiencing this type of restlesness?

patterns: Where can I get help
what should I do if Im restless
Where can I get help
Yes, and I need help about this
responses: If you need help, talking to your doctor is a good place to start. Your doctor can help you by creating a mental health treatment plan, if necessary. To help you cope with feelings of restlessness or irritability, try some of the following tips. Meditate — meditation can train the mind to ignore impulses and enable you to stay calmer and focused during periods of anxiety or stress. Mindfulness can reduce stress and help you to manage depression and anxiety. Try breathing exercises — they can reduce stress and improve symptoms of anxiety and depression. Talk to your family, friends and work colleagues — don’t bottle up your emotions. If you have an issue with someone, try to deal with it straight away so you’re not stewing over it and causing yourself unnecessary stress. Cry if you need to — some people find it can make them feel better. Don’t feel embarrassed. Crying may ease pressure and tension. Eat a balanced diet — a poor diet can increase feelings of anxiety and depression. Get enough sleep — sleep is closely linked to your mental health.

patterns: I feel irritable

Why do I feel irritable
I dont know why Im feeling this way

Irritability is a common emotion. Many factors can cause or contribute to irritability, including life stress, a lack of sleep, low blood sugar levels, and hormonal changes.

I encourage you to focus on your present and future. Try to start letting go and moving forward. Remember that you are in control of your own thoughts. Take a step to make you feel better. Goodluck!

patterns: I'm worried about my health
How can I manage the emotional and psychological effects of chronic illness?
What is the effect of chronic illness?
responses: Not all causes of unhappiness are due to mental or behavioral patterns. Sometimes, chronic health issues can lead to depression and anxiety. If you are struggling with intense unhappiness that you can’t seem to manage, seek the help of a mental health professional.
I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling worried about your health. It's absolutely understandable to feel anxious and overwhelmed when it comes to chronic illnesses.
I encourage you to focus on your present and future. Try to start letting go and moving forward. Remember that you are in control of your own thoughts. Take a step to make you feel better. Goodluck!

The effects of chronic illness can be difficult to manage, but remember that it's not something you have to go through alone. There are so many resources available to help, and don't be afraid to ask for help if you need it.

patterns: What are the warning signs of serious health problems?
How to have a healthy diet?
How can I improve my sleep quality?
responses: Hey there, I'm sorry to hear that you are worried about your health. The most important thing is to look out for any warning signs that might suggest something more serious is going on. Some warning signs can be: sudden pain or swelling in your body, a severe fever that won't go away, difficulty breathing, changes in your vision, sudden confusion or dizziness, chest pain, difficulty swallowing, and an irregular heartbeat.

A healthy diet includes lots of fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, whole grains, healthy fats, and low-fat dairy products. Try to limit processed and refined foods as much as possible, and make sure to drink plenty of water throughout the day.

Start by creating a bedtime routine that works for you. Try to get 7-8 hours of sleep each night, avoid screens and stimulants at least an hour before bedtime, and make sure your room is dark, quiet and comfortable.

patterns: I feel pretty down
Can you tell me a joke or an interesting fact to help me shift my focus?
Hahahahahahahaha
responses: There is always some chance that things can go wrong. But if you always anticipate failure, failure is much more likely. Optimism gives you the energy and drive to make things better, even they’re not perfect.
A joke: What did the fish say when it hit the wall? Dam!
Great! I make you smile and laugh.

patterns: I always do not act on my goals
How will I continue to motivate myself to maintain focus and continue making progress?
How can I overcome these problem?
responses: You may have goals and dreams, but procrastinating or not acting on them can make you feel dissatisfied and unfulfilled. Take small steps to work towards your goals instead of simply building castles in the air.

I know it can be so difficult to take action on our goals and can be really discouraging when we don't make progress. I think one way to help motivate yourself and stay focused is to break down your goal into smaller, more achievable goals.

To overcome these obstacles, start small by breaking your goal into concrete and manageable steps, set realistic timelines and expectations, find positive motivators to keep you going, practice self-compassion, make a plan and stick to it, and make sure you hold yourself accountable.
